item.title: "Leaders Are People Who Go Their Own Way Without Looking to See if Anyone Is Following"
item.description: "Leaders Are People Who Go Their Own Way Without Looking to See if Anyone Is Following" [Quotables]: "Leaders ar... http://t.co/c9FPgku
item.content:encoded: "Leaders Are People Who Go Their Own Way Without Looking to See if Anyone Is Following" [Quotables]: "Leaders ar... http://t.co/c9FPgku "Leaders are not what many people think–people with huge crowds following them. Leaders are people who go their own way without caring, or even looking to see whether anyone is following them. 'Leadership qualities' are not the qualities that enable people to attract followers, but those that enable them to do without them. The include, at the very least, courage, endurance, patience, humor, flexibility, resourcefulness, determination, a keen sense of reality, and the ability to keep a cool and clear head even when things are going badly. This is the opposite of the 'charisma' that we hear so much about." ~ John Holt Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: lifehacker.com

item.title: Volunteering Will Save Your Career (Or Put You In A New One) | Fast Company
item.description: Same people who didn't think to include volunteer work on resumes say they'd hire volunteers over others. Weird. http://t.co/opZM299
item.content:encoded: Same people who didn't think to include volunteer work on resumes say they'd hire volunteers over others. Weird. http://t.co/opZM299 Starting today, LinkedIn will let users list their public-spirited deeds and philanthropic efforts alongside job experience under a new section called "Volunteer Experience and Causes." According to a survey by the social network, more than ever volunteer experience is valuable information that could give job hunters the boost they need to get promoted or hired. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: fastcompany.com
